result.execSummary:
The defendant John M. Stewart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John M. Stewart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John M. Stewart was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • John M. Stewart was found guilty of Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Will be allowed the first (1) time a payment is missed. 10:05 AM Defendant John M. Stewart not in court.  Agent Carson Kulow from DOC appeared in court. Def called the clerk's office he forget. Court; hearing was set for 9:55 and is proceeding. records.addlTxt: 10:27 AM Defendant John M. Stewart appeared pro se by video means from PCJ.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CSW Jenny Kruse in Court.  Court reviews court record; noting 08/14/18 MH.  Motion filed by DA on 02/14/19.  Order imposing 30 days Jail and revoking EHM signed on 03/06/19.  Defendant makes statement.  State states position and requests Defendant sit time in Jail, notes balance.  Defendant notes he spoke with CSW Kruse in December regarding less work hours and advises of different employment.  Court questions when EHM/sentence is complete, Defendant advises 07/12/19.  DA Froelich responds.  Court questions employment.  Court will release Defendant on 03/20/19 to EHM.  Court orders remaining 15 days stayed.  Court states if any payments are missed Defendant will need to serve 45 days w/o work release.  (Approximately 17 months of not missing payment).
Hearing on March 14, 2019 at 10:15 am.
from John Stewart re: Receipt from $2400.00 child support payment and asking for EHM
from John M Stewart re: asking you to continue home monitoring as he had full time employment
(30 days jail and EHM is revoked)
(30 days jail and EHM revoked)
to Impose Jail and Revoke Electronic Home Monitoring filed by Atty Froelich

10:17 Defendant John M. Stewart in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Defendant John M. Stewart in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to impose jail sanction filed by Atty Froelich. Froelich: based on JOC, 30 day jail each time a payment has been missed. last payment was February 2017. Requests 11 month imposed jail sentence. Atty Nelson responds; Def has employment. Def has sat 30 days. Requests shorter conditional jail time like 5 months with huber. Froelich objects to huber. Def addresses the court. Court: orders 11 months jail with electronic home monitoring allowed.  $800 payments each month while on work release. If one payment is missed, work release will be revoked.  Defendant to remain in custody until August 23, 2018 at 10 when he will be hooked up for electronic home monitoring, as long as he makes arrangements with PCSO. First $800 payment due in September. Release date: July 12, 2019  10:32
filed by Atty Nelson

01:34 Defendant John M. Stewart in court, in custody. Atty Liesl Nelson in court for the defendant. Sean E. Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich: filed motion, 30 days of jail imposed for missed child support payments, last payment made in Feb. 2017. Atty Liesl Nelson addresses the court:reschedule to have counsel appointed:  Froelich: Defendant to remain in custody; review some matters. Court: defendant to remain incustody. Nelson requests work release. Froelich: opposes EHM requests straight jail time. Court: number of days.  hearing on huber may be necessary in the future. Court: set another court date, defendant will remain in custody.  01:57

8:34  This includes 15CT154  Defendant John M. Stewart in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich - 15CT154  Dismiss case.  On 15CF229 Plead guilty to Ct 1 & 2 of the information.  All remaining counts will be dismissed.  Probation  Cond:  Pay $400 / mo child support, Costs, DNA  
  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1 and Ct 2 of 15CF229    Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 & 2 of the information.  Court dismisses the remaining counts in 15CF229 and 15CT154 is dismissed. Court orders S/W Probation  5 years on each count conc to each other. Conditions:  Pay $400.00 per month child support by the last day of each month.  If the defendant misses one payment the defendant will serve a 30 days jail.  Huber would be allowed on the first time a payment is missed. Follow all rules imposed by the agent.   Court costs on each count DNA sample and surcharge. No sentence credit due.  Bond will apply to the Trust Account as the October payment.

records.addlTxt: 3:52 Defendant John M. Stewart in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie: complaint was filed with warrant. Court quashes warrant. 15CT154 heard at this time.   Defendant has copy of complaints.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaints.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty to 15CT154. Court enters. Thorie: $200 cash bond on 15CF229. $1000 signature bond on 15CT154. Larimore has no objection.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
